intro: Vitellariopsis dispar, commonly known as the African violet. It is a member of the Gesneriaceae family and is native to tropical regions of Africa. The plant is characterized by its dense, velvety foliage and clusters of showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to purple. It thrives in bright, indirect light and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Vitellariopsis dispar is often cultivated as a decorative plant due to its ornamental value and ease of care.
